duck: Datacasting - Datacasting is the broadcasting of data over a wide area via radio waves.
Raster scan - A raster scan, or raster scanning, is the rectangular pattern of image capture and reconstruction in television.

The vertical blanking interval, also known as the vertical interval or VBLANK, is the time difference between the last line of one frame or field of a raster display, and the beginning of the first line of the next frame.
Nominal analogue blanking - Nominal analog blanking or nominal analogue blanking is the outermost part of the overscan of a standard definition digital television image.
Horizontal blanking interval - Horizontal blanking interval refers to a part of the process of displaying images on a computer monitor or television screen via raster scanning.
